dyeHardProceduralAPI

Class DHProceduralAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.BaseCode
      • Engine.LibraryCode
        • dyehard.DyeHardGame
          • dyeHardProceduralAPI.DHProceduralAPI

  • public class DHProceduralAPI
extends dyehard.DyeHardGame
    DHProceduralAPI class is a procedural API for Dye Hard game. This API is designed to use as part of introductory computer science lessons.
    Author:
    Vuochly (Nin) Ky, Holden

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class dyehard.DyeHardGame

        Used in the wrapper API function isKeyboardButtonDown, this array maps a shorter abbreviation like 'RIGHT' to the virtual key event 'KeyEvent.VK_RIGHT' (Source: SpaceSmasherFunctionalAPI/SpaceSmasherProceduralAPI)

        public void apiRestartGame()

      • apiHandleWinLose

        public void apiHandleWinLose()
        Check the game conditions and handle when the user is win or Lose. Display the winning menu when the user have reached the goal distance or goal score. Otherwise display the losing menu when the user have no remaining lives.

      • apiAdjustScoreBy

        public void apiAdjustScoreBy(int n)
        Adjusts the score based on the argument. If n is positive, the score is increasing by n. (n, increasing) If n is negative, the score is decreasing by n. (-n, decreasing)
        Parameters:
        n - the value to adjust

      • apiIsKeyboardButtonTapped

        public boolean apiIsKeyboardButtonTapped(KeysEnum key)
        Check if the given key is tapped on the keyboard. The key is triggered only once when the key is first pressed. Holding the key will return false -- the function only returns true once per key press. (Note: the button 'tapped' and button 'down' or 'pressed' are different.)
        Parameters:
        key - - the key on the keyboard. Ex: KeysEnum.a => the 'a' or 'A' key.
        Returns:
        - true if the key is tapped, false otherwise

      • apiIsKeyboardButtonPressed

        public boolean apiIsKeyboardButtonPressed(KeysEnum key)
        Check if the given key is pressed on the keyboard. The key is triggered when the key is held down. (Note: the button 'tapped' and button 'down' or 'pressed' are different.)
        Parameters:
        key - - the key on the keyboard. Ex: KeysEnum.a => the 'a' or 'A' key.
        Returns:
        - true if the key is pressed, false otherwise

      • apiIsKeyboardLeftPressed

        true if the left arrow key on the keyboard is down

      • apiStartDebrisSpawner

        public void apiStartDebrisSpawner()

        public void apiStartDebrisSpawner(double interval)
        Sets up the debris generator using a specified interval.

        Debris spawn at random locations along the right edge.
        Parameters:
        interval - The interval to spawn debris.

        public void apiStartDyePackSpawner()
        Spawns DyePack object randomly on the right of the game window every 2 seconds

      • apiStartDyePackSpawner

        public void apiStartDyePackSpawner(double interval)
        Spawns DyePack object randomly on the right of the game window with the specified interval
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval in second to spawns DyePack

      • apiStopDyePackSpawner

        public void apiStopDyePackSpawner()
        Disables the DyePack spawner

      • apiSpawnSingleDyePack

        public int apiSpawnSingleDyePack()
        Spawns a single moving DyePack with a random height and color
        Returns:
        an integer which represents the id of the DyePack

      • apiSpawnSingleDyePack

        public int apiSpawnSingleDyePack(java.lang.String color,
                                 double x,
                                 double y)
        Spawns a single DyePack with the specified color (as a String) and location and this also disables initial movement
        Parameters:
        color - [ "red" | "blue" | "green" | "teal" | "yellow" | "pink" ]. Note: if the color specified is not in the list of color, function will pick red as the default
        x - the x-coordinate position of the DyePack
        y - the Y-coordinate position of the DyePack
        Returns:
        an integer which represents the id of the DyePack

      • apiSpawnSinglePowerUp

        public int apiSpawnSinglePowerUp(double positionX,
                                 double positionY)
        Spawns random PowerUp object at a specified location. Note: There are 4 types of PowerUp, SpeedUp, SlowDown, Ghost, and Invincibility
        Parameters:
        positionX - the x-coordinate position of the DyePack
        positionY - the y-coordinate position of the DyePack
        Returns:
        an Integer to represent the ID of the PowerUp

      • apiSpawnSinglePowerUp

        public int apiSpawnSinglePowerUp(java.lang.String type,
                                 double positionX,
                                 double positionY)
        Spawn a PowerUp specified by the type at a specified location There are 4 types of PowerUp: SpeedUp, SlowDown, Ghost, and Invincibility
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the PowerUp as a string (case insensitive)
        positionX - the x-coordinate position of the DyePack
        positionY - the y-coordinate position of the DyePack
        Returns:
        an Integer to represent the ID of the PowerUp

        public void apiSpawnGates()

      • apiAddOneWormHole

        public void apiAddOneWormHole(java.awt.Color color,
                              double width,
                              double height,
                              double x,
                              double y)
        Adds a WormHole to the game with the given Color, Width, Height, X-coordinate, Y-coordinate
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the WormHole
        width - the width of the WormHole
        height - the height of the WormHole
        x - the X-coordinate of the center position of the WormHole
        y - the Y-coordinate of the center position of the WormHole

        Displays the score UI on the game screen.
        Parameters:
        display - true to display, false otherwise

      • apiShowDistanceMeter

        Displays the distance meter on the game window
